body: I updated the bug report, `What is the expected result?` section - incorrect `/test/api/v1/login` URL was used originally, correct expected URL should have been `/test/api/v1/users/login`.

@samdark is the reason for this stated in https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/4829#issuecomment-53610874 still valid? We have now [caching in UrlManager](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/framework/web/UrlManager.php#L421).

@bizley [caching was added in 2015](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/commit/ebc089e6c26ba85642e5b32eaae017c6b637be79) so theoretically it should solve the problem but I'm not entirely sure it actually solves the problem in question.
Two benchmarks, before/after are needed to decide on it.

Ok, my benchmarks below:

Tested change is: [these lines](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/2.0.40/framework/rest/UrlRule.php#L208-L210) are commented out.

issue case:
```php
$manager = new \yii\web\UrlManager(
    [
        'scriptUrl' => '',
        'enablePrettyUrl' => true,
        'rules' => [
            new \yii\rest\UrlRule(['controller' => 'user', 'extraPatterns' => ['POST login' => 'login']])
        ]
    ]
);
$result = $manager->createUrl(['user/login']);
```
| | original | changed |
|-|-|-|
| `$result ==` | `/user/login` | `/users/login` |

All times in seconds. Debug mode on.

## Positive match / single rule

UrlManager config:
```php
[
    'cache' => new \yii\caching\ArrayCache(), // or null when not cached
    'scriptUrl' => '',
    'enablePrettyUrl' => true,
    'rules' => [new \yii\rest\UrlRule(['controller' => 'user'])],
]
```
Tested pattern: `['user/view', 'id' => 1]`
Expected result: `/users/1`
Average time for 1 000 000 iterations:

| cached | original | changed |
|-|-|-|
| yes | 1.0067E-5 | 1.0368E-5 |
| no | 0.8548E-5 | 0.8680E-5 |

## Negative match / single rule

UrlManager config:
```php
[
    'cache' => new \yii\caching\ArrayCache(), // or null when not cached
    'scriptUrl' => '',
    'enablePrettyUrl' => true,
    'rules' => [new \yii\rest\UrlRule(['controller' => 'user'])],
]
```
Tested pattern: `['diff/view', 'id' => 1]`
Expected result: `/diff/view?id=1`
Average time for 1 000 000 iterations:

| cached | original | changed |
|-|-|-|
| yes | 4.7399E-6 | 4.8223E-6 |
| no | 4.9347E-6 | 4.8816E-6 |

## Positive match / multiple rules

UrlManager config:
```php
[
    'cache' => new \yii\caching\ArrayCache(), // or null when not cached
    'scriptUrl' => '',
    'enablePrettyUrl' => true,
    'rules' => $rules,
]
```
rules:
```php
$rules = [];
$chars = range('a', 'z');
foreach ($chars as $c1) {
    foreach ($chars as $c2) {
        $rules[] = new \yii\rest\UrlRule(['controller' => $c1 . $c2]);
    }
}
$rules[] = new \yii\rest\UrlRule(['controller' => 'user']);
```

Tested pattern: `['user/view', 'id' => 1]`
Expected result: `/users/1`
Average time for 100 000 iterations and 677 rules:

| cached | original | changed |
|-|-|-|
| yes | 1.0044E-5 | 1.0339E-5 |
| no | 1.0024E-5 | 1.0440E-5 |

## Negative match / multiple rules

UrlManager config:
```php
[
    'cache' => new \yii\caching\ArrayCache(), // or null when not cached
    'scriptUrl' => '',
    'enablePrettyUrl' => true,
    'rules' => $rules,
]
```
rules:
```php
$rules = [];
$chars = range('a', 'z');
foreach ($chars as $c1) {
    foreach ($chars as $c2) {
        $rules[] = new \yii\rest\UrlRule(['controller' => $c1 . $c2]);
    }
}
```

Tested pattern: `['diff/view', 'id' => 1]`
Expected result: `/diff/view?id=1`
Average time for 100 000 iterations and 676 rules:

| cached | original | changed |
|-|-|-|
| yes | 0.0012 | 0.0012 |
| no | 0.0013 | 0.0013 |

## conclusion

Slightly longer after the change but it looks negligible. To be honest it looks negligible without a cache as well so either it should not be made like that from the very beginning or this benchmark is missing something.
I don't see any significant difference and the difference isn't in favor of changed variant.
Why? The change isn't affecting the time and it allows to create URLs for verbs other than GET.
Yes, I mean performance difference is not a problem. We can have the change.

issue.title: Allowing non-GET-verb URL rules to have a URL created

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
| Q             | A
| ------------- | ---
| Is bugfix?    | ❌
| New feature?  | ✔️
| Breaks BC?    | only if someone depends on non-GET rule URL to not be created
| Tests pass?   | ✔️
| Fixed issues  | #18487
